meanings.definition: Giving a false impression or leading to a mistaken belief.
meanings.sent1: The magician's delusive tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The delusive advertisement promised quick weight loss.
meanings.sent3: The delusive mirror made her appear taller than she really was.
meanings.sent4: The delusive mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The delusive dream of winning the lottery kept him hopeful.

meanings.sent1: The delusive salesman convinced many customers to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent2: Her delusive smile hid her true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent3: The delusive path through the forest led them in circles.
meanings.sent4: The delusive appearance of calmness masked the storm within.
meanings.sent5: The delusive promise of easy money lured him into a risky scheme.
